I always worry that hosts will be hovering, but Tim showed us around upon arrival and then left us alone.
We will stay there again if in the area.

In most Airbnb you get the spare items from the owners home or things like that. Not here. Washer, dryer, kitchen appliances, furniture and bedroom set were great. The bed is really comfortable, hotel style comfortable I would say. The place was also spot clean and you have all you need to do your own cleaning if you feel like. Internet is really fast, We actually worked everyday remotely without issues, considering my job demands VPN connection and advanced graphics. The surroundings of the property are nice as well. There is a little trail (about 10 min) in the premises of property where you can go for a walk and decompress. Matagorda Beach is 35 min away, which we visited a few times and you can get some restaurants in Palacios (15 min away) or Bay City (20 min away). If you are looking for a place to stay in the area, don't look any further.

Absolutely beautiful place! This place is so special❤️. You will not regret booking here, I promise. There isn’t enough room on this page to give the amazing review that this cabin deserves but I’ll do my best! From the moment we drove up to the property i knew we had found something special. It’s like a little dollhouse! Sooo adorable! I have never seen a place with so much love put into it, not to mention it was probably the cleanest place I’ve ever stayed. From the minute we walked in the door, we walked around and ooh’d and ahh’d for probably 20 minutes. We couldn’t believe we found something as cute as it was! The owners were so sweet and were more than happy to help us with whatever we needed. Kathy (the owner) had a bottle of wine, an amazing coffee cake that she had baked for us, along with fresh eggs, beer, water and orange juice in the refrigerator. She also had hot chocolate, hot apple cider, several creamers and coffees to choose from and even some different breakfast stuff to choose from. The kitchen was fully stocked with plenty of plates, silverware, spices, and pots and pans to cook whatever we wanted. The bed was the most comfortable bed I’ve ever slept in and had amazing sheets that made it hard to get out of ❤️. Kathy had plenty of extra blankets and pillows if you wanted them along with gorgeous thick towels for after the shower, and even some for after the hot tub that can be warmed in the towel warmer on the back porch that was amazing😍 There’s a bluetooth speaker and a little table with chairs to hang out while you cook on the grill. The wooden play scape, fire pit, corn hole boards, horse shoes, and gas grill is so perfect for families with little ones. Not to mention the two hammocks that are in the most perfect spots to hang out in. The pond right outside the front door of the cabin is adorable and my boys had a ball sleeping in a tent and getting up early to fish the next morning.
They are still talking about how much fun they had and how they didn’t want to leave. It’s truly a hidden gem. We loved it and will definitely be back! Kathy and her husband are the sweetest and truly thought of everything to make our stay so special. Thank you for everything!

Do not miss your opportunity to visit with Phoenix the horse and the goats; they were all so very friendly and so fun to pet and interact with. Watch at dawn and dusk for deer. Be aware, both of our mobile phones (on two separate service networks) had no connection in this remote location, but the cabin's good wi-fi made up for that. review_text: This is a peaceful place to stay. It is a room/event space on a ranch in East Bernard, TX. There are many chickens and cows on the property that you can see (the roosters may even wake you up bright and early!). The property also has hammocks, a fire pit, and a pond. Definitely a "farm- life" getaway from the city. We stayed here overnight because we were attending a wedding in Wharton, TX. The wedding venue was about 25 minutes away from this AirBnB. I will say that this part of Texas is pretty rural. Be sure to pack food (snacks) and water for your trip as well as cold weather clothing, thicker socks, hiking shoes or boots, and flashlights. There is not much close by (restraunts, stores, etc.). The exception is a Bucc-ee's about 12 minutes away from the Air BnB. This is your best source of supplies if you need something during your trip. Cellphone data coverage may be limited on the property, but wifi is included in the room. The room includes a refrigerator and microwave for food storage and preperation. A coffee machine and coffee are provided in the room. Robert and Sarah are very accommodating. Robert even helped us start a fire after a rain storm and offered us a bottle of wine to help relax. Very nice customer service! They have a dog named Buddy who is the sweetest thing. You can play with him as much as you like! Overall a great stay. Escape the city and unwind in the country!

They also brought out firewood and got the firepit going and turned on the lights around the firepit. We really enjoyed sitting out on the clear night and enjoying the fire. They have hammocks and make the area very inviting. It is truly out in the country, so if you are squeamish about mice, you may not want to book the big "conference" room. There was evidence in the bathroom of one and then when I went in there, there was one. He/she quickly cleared out upon sight of me... LOL! It is spacious, but the bathrooms and refrigerator are at the total opposite end of where the bedroom is and where the table with microwave and coffee are set up. The only other thing was that the breaker kept tripping. The first time was around midnight the first night, so we had to go knock on their door to find out where the breaker box was, etc. It happened at least one more time that night and two or three times the next night. That was a little frustrating that we would have to go out in the cold and flip the breaker. Rosarita Ranch is quite literally in the middle of nowhere, and I would not have had it any other way. A series of country roads will get you to the front gate, which is where Sarah first met me and my girlfriend, Gail. She took us on a tour of the place and we instantly felt welcomed. The ranch is home to a menagerie of critters, from donkeys to chickens to Buddy the dog, and a few others I did not get to see. Everyday we were provided breakfast by Sarah and Robert, which ranged from homemade omelets to waffles to fruit and oatmeal. Robert is a very interesting man who spends his time hunting and practicing taxidermy. Overall, it was a tremendously awesome experience which I would highly recommend if you are ever down the East Bernard way.
